content.en: Coalition formation algorithms: Researchers have been exploring the capabilities of algorithms in addressing various challenges in coalition formation. One study found that previous algorithms for generating coalition structures were unable to establish any bound. However, another study showed that three anytime algorithms for coalition structure generation outperformed theoretical worst-case results. Additionally, an algorithm was developed that achieved global optimal and stable solutions in coalition formation by using the mechanism of distribution according to work. These findings highlight the potential of algorithms in improving the efficiency and effectiveness of coalition formation in multi-agent systems.
content.da: Koalitionsdannelsesalgoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt algoritmers evner til at håndtere forskellige udfordringer i koalitionsdannelse. En undersøgelse fandt, at tidligere algoritmer til generering af koalitionsstrukturer ikke var i stand til at etablere nogen grænse. Dog viste en anden undersøgelse, at tre anytime-algoritmer til generering af koalitionsstrukturer overgik teoretiske værst tænkelige resultater. Desuden blev der udviklet en algoritme, der opnåede globale optimale og stabile løsninger i koalitionsdannelse ved at anvende fordelingsmekanismen i henhold til arbejde. Disse fund fremhæver potentialet i algoritmer til at forbedre effektiviteten og effektiviteten af koalitionsdannelse i multi-agentsystemer.
